description: Gets information about the rule. Requires permission to access the GetTopicRule action.

nested_items.name: ruleArn
nested_items.description: The rule ARN.

nested_items.name: ruleName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule.

nested_items.name: sql
nested_items.description: The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the rule.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the rule was created.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: operation
nested_items.description: The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution template, so it can be ${operation}, but the substitution must result in one of the following: INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

nested_items.name: hashKeyField
nested_items.description: The hash key name.

nested_items.name: hashKeyValue
nested_items.description: The hash key value.

nested_items.name: hashKeyType
nested_items.description: The hash key type. Valid values are 'STRING' or 'NUMBER'

nested_items.name: rangeKeyField
nested_items.description: The range key name.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyValue
nested_items.description: The range key value.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyType
nested_items.description: The range key type. Valid values are 'STRING' or 'NUMBER'

nested_items.name: payloadField
nested_items.description: The action payload. This name can be customized.

nested_items.name: dynamoDBv2
nested_items.description: Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a separate DynamoDB column.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The table where the message data will be written.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the SNS topic.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: messageFormat
nested_items.description: (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted values are 'JSON' and 'RAW'. The default value of the attribute is 'RAW'. SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html refer to their official documentation.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: queueUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the Amazon SQS queue.

nested_items.name: useBase64
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use Base64 encoding.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis stream.

nested_items.name: streamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis stream.

nested_items.name: partitionKey
nested_items.description: The partition key.

nested_items.name: republish
nested_items.description: Publish to another MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: topic
nested_items.description: The name of the MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: qos
nested_items.description: The Quality of Service (QoS) level to use when republishing messages. The default value is 0.

nested_items.name: payloadFormatIndicator
nested_items.description: An Enum string value that indicates whether the payload is formatted as UTF-8.

nested_items.name: contentType
nested_items.description: A UTF-8 encoded string that describes the content of the publishing message.

nested_items.name: responseTopic
nested_items.description: A UTF-8 encoded string that's used as the topic name for a response message. The response topic is used to describe the topic which the receiver should publish to as part of the request-response flow. The topic must not contain wildcard characters.

nested_items.name: correlationData
nested_items.description: The base64-encoded binary data used by the sender of the request message to identify which request the response message is for when it's received.

nested_items.name: messageExpiry
nested_items.description: A user-defined integer value that will persist a message at the message broker for a specified amount of time to ensure that the message will expire if it's no longer relevant to the subscriber. The value of messageExpiry represents the number of seconds before it expires. For more information about the limits of messageExpiry, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core message broker and protocol limits and quotas from the Amazon Web Services Reference Guide.

nested_items.name: userProperties
nested_items.description: An array of key-value pairs that you define in the MQTT5 header.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: A key to be specified in UserProperty.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A value to be specified in UserProperty.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The object key. For more information, see Actions, resources, and condition keys for Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: cannedAcl
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified by the object key. For more information, see S3 canned ACLs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: deliveryStreamName
nested_items.description: The delivery stream name.

nested_items.name: separator
nested_items.description: A character separator that will be used to separate records written to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: --n' (newline), --t' (tab), --rn' (Windows newline), --,' (comma).

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by using PutRecordBatch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchMetric
nested_items.description: Capture a CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: metricNamespace
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric namespace name.

nested_items.name: metricName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric name.

nested_items.name: metricValue
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric value.

nested_items.name: metricUnit
nested_items.description: The metric unit supported by CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: metricTimestamp
nested_items.description: An optional Unix timestamp.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchAlarm
nested_items.description: Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: alarmName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch alarm name.

nested_items.name: stateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the alarm change.

nested_items.name: stateValue
nested_items.description: The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchLogs
nested_items.description: Send data to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch log.

nested_items.name: logGroupName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch log group to which the action sends data.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Indicates whether batches of log records will be extracted and uploaded into CloudWatch. Values include true or false (default).

nested_items.name: elasticsearch
nested_items.description: Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: The index where you want to store your data.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of document you are storing.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

nested_items.name: salesforce
nested_items.description: Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.

nested_items.name: token
nested_items.description: The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

nested_items.name: iotAnalytics
nested_items.description: Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.

nested_items.name: channelArn
nested_items.description: (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

nested_items.name: channelName
nested_items.description: The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).

nested_items.name: iotEvents
nested_items.description: Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.

nested_items.name: inputName
nested_items.description: The name of the IoT Events input.

nested_items.name: messageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the message. The default messageId is a new UUID value.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an IoT Events detector. ('Action':'iotevents:BatchPutMessage').

nested_items.name: iotSiteWise
nested_items.description: Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT SiteWise asset properties.

nested_items.name: putAssetPropertyValueEntries
nested_items.description: A list of asset property value entries.

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.

nested_items.name: assetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyAlias
nested_items.description: The name of the property alias associated with your asset property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyValues
nested_items.description: A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: Optional. The string value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: integerValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the integer value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the double value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the boolean value ( true or false) of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The asset property value timestamp.

nested_items.name: timeInSeconds
nested_items.description: A string that contains the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: offsetInNanos
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that describes the quality of the value. Accepts substitution templates. Must be GOOD, BAD, or UNCERTAIN.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset property value to IoT SiteWise. ( "Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"). The trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.

nested_items.name: stepFunctions
nested_items.description: Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.

nested_items.name: executionNamePrefix
nested_items.description: (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution if one is not provided.

nested_items.name: stateMachineName
nested_items.description: The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be started.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a state machine ('Action':'states:StartExecution').

nested_items.name: timestream
nested_items.description: The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the Timestream topic rule action documentation.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon Timestream database table.

nested_items.name: databaseName
nested_items.description: The name of an Amazon Timestream database.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the database table into which to write the measure records.

nested_items.name: dimensions
nested_items.description: Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each measure record.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the Amazon Timestream database table record.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value to write in this column of the database record.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the time column.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: An expression that returns a long epoch time value.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression described in value.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a confirmationUrl. If this is a new destination, a new TopicRuleDestination is created if possible.

nested_items.name: confirmationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.

nested_items.name: headers
nested_items.description: The HTTP headers to send with the message data.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The HTTP header key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.

nested_items.name: signingRegion
nested_items.description: The signing region.

nested_items.name: serviceName
nested_items.description: The service name to use while signing with Sig V4.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing role.

nested_items.name: destinationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of Kafka action's VPC TopicRuleDestination.

nested_items.name: topic
nested_items.description: The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The Kafka message key.

nested_items.name: partition
nested_items.description: The Kafka message partition.

nested_items.name: clientProperties
nested_items.description: Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: headers
nested_items.description: The list of Kafka headers that you specify.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the Kafka header.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the Kafka header.

nested_items.name: openSearch
nested_items.description: Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: The OpenSearch index where you want to store your data.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of document you are storing.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that grants permission to write to the Amazon Location resource.

nested_items.name: trackerName
nested_items.description: The name of the tracker resource in Amazon Location in which the location is updated.

nested_items.name: deviceId
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the device providing the location data.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The time that the location data was sampled. The default value is the time the MQTT message was processed.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: An expression that returns a long epoch time value.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression described in value.

nested_items.name: latitude
nested_items.description: A string that evaluates to a double value that represents the latitude of the device's location.

nested_items.name: longitude
nested_items.description: A string that evaluates to a double value that represents the longitude of the device's location.

nested_items.name: ruleDisabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the rule is disabled.

nested_items.name: awsIotSqlVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

nested_items.name: errorAction
nested_items.description: The action to perform when an error occurs.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: operation
nested_items.description: The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution template, so it can be ${operation}, but the substitution must result in one of the following: INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

nested_items.name: hashKeyField
nested_items.description: The hash key name.

nested_items.name: hashKeyValue
nested_items.description: The hash key value.

nested_items.name: hashKeyType
nested_items.description: The hash key type. Valid values are 'STRING' or 'NUMBER'

nested_items.name: rangeKeyField
nested_items.description: The range key name.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyValue
nested_items.description: The range key value.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyType
nested_items.description: The range key type. Valid values are 'STRING' or 'NUMBER'

nested_items.name: payloadField
nested_items.description: The action payload. This name can be customized.

nested_items.name: dynamoDBv2
nested_items.description: Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a separate DynamoDB column.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The table where the message data will be written.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the SNS topic.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: messageFormat
nested_items.description: (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted values are 'JSON' and 'RAW'. The default value of the attribute is 'RAW'. SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html refer to their official documentation.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: queueUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the Amazon SQS queue.

nested_items.name: useBase64
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use Base64 encoding.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis stream.

nested_items.name: streamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis stream.

nested_items.name: partitionKey
nested_items.description: The partition key.

nested_items.name: republish
nested_items.description: Publish to another MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: topic
nested_items.description: The name of the MQTT topic.

nested_items.name: qos
nested_items.description: The Quality of Service (QoS) level to use when republishing messages. The default value is 0.

nested_items.name: payloadFormatIndicator
nested_items.description: An Enum string value that indicates whether the payload is formatted as UTF-8.

nested_items.name: contentType
nested_items.description: A UTF-8 encoded string that describes the content of the publishing message.

nested_items.name: responseTopic
nested_items.description: A UTF-8 encoded string that's used as the topic name for a response message. The response topic is used to describe the topic which the receiver should publish to as part of the request-response flow. The topic must not contain wildcard characters.

nested_items.name: correlationData
nested_items.description: The base64-encoded binary data used by the sender of the request message to identify which request the response message is for when it's received.

nested_items.name: messageExpiry
nested_items.description: A user-defined integer value that will persist a message at the message broker for a specified amount of time to ensure that the message will expire if it's no longer relevant to the subscriber. The value of messageExpiry represents the number of seconds before it expires. For more information about the limits of messageExpiry, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core message broker and protocol limits and quotas from the Amazon Web Services Reference Guide.

nested_items.name: userProperties
nested_items.description: An array of key-value pairs that you define in the MQTT5 header.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: A key to be specified in UserProperty.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A value to be specified in UserProperty.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The object key. For more information, see Actions, resources, and condition keys for Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: cannedAcl
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified by the object key. For more information, see S3 canned ACLs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: deliveryStreamName
nested_items.description: The delivery stream name.

nested_items.name: separator
nested_items.description: A character separator that will be used to separate records written to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: --n' (newline), --t' (tab), --rn' (Windows newline), --,' (comma).

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by using PutRecordBatch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchMetric
nested_items.description: Capture a CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: metricNamespace
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric namespace name.

nested_items.name: metricName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric name.

nested_items.name: metricValue
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch metric value.

nested_items.name: metricUnit
nested_items.description: The metric unit supported by CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: metricTimestamp
nested_items.description: An optional Unix timestamp.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchAlarm
nested_items.description: Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.

nested_items.name: alarmName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch alarm name.

nested_items.name: stateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the alarm change.

nested_items.name: stateValue
nested_items.description: The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA.

nested_items.name: cloudwatchLogs
nested_items.description: Send data to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch log.

nested_items.name: logGroupName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch log group to which the action sends data.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Indicates whether batches of log records will be extracted and uploaded into CloudWatch. Values include true or false (default).

nested_items.name: elasticsearch
nested_items.description: Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: The index where you want to store your data.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of document you are storing.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

nested_items.name: salesforce
nested_items.description: Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.

nested_items.name: token
nested_items.description: The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

nested_items.name: iotAnalytics
nested_items.description: Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.

nested_items.name: channelArn
nested_items.description: (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

nested_items.name: channelName
nested_items.description: The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).

nested_items.name: iotEvents
nested_items.description: Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.

nested_items.name: inputName
nested_items.description: The name of the IoT Events input.

nested_items.name: messageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the message. The default messageId is a new UUID value.

nested_items.name: batchMode
nested_items.description: Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an IoT Events detector. ('Action':'iotevents:BatchPutMessage').

nested_items.name: iotSiteWise
nested_items.description: Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT SiteWise asset properties.

nested_items.name: putAssetPropertyValueEntries
nested_items.description: A list of asset property value entries.

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.

nested_items.name: assetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyAlias
nested_items.description: The name of the property alias associated with your asset property. You must specify either a propertyAlias or both an aliasId and a propertyId. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: propertyValues
nested_items.description: A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: Optional. The string value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: integerValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the integer value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the double value of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the boolean value ( true or false) of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The asset property value timestamp.

nested_items.name: timeInSeconds
nested_items.description: A string that contains the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: offsetInNanos
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts substitution templates.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: Optional. A string that describes the quality of the value. Accepts substitution templates. Must be GOOD, BAD, or UNCERTAIN.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset property value to IoT SiteWise. ( "Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"). The trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.

nested_items.name: stepFunctions
nested_items.description: Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.

nested_items.name: executionNamePrefix
nested_items.description: (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution if one is not provided.

nested_items.name: stateMachineName
nested_items.description: The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be started.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a state machine ('Action':'states:StartExecution').

nested_items.name: timestream
nested_items.description: The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the Timestream topic rule action documentation.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon Timestream database table.

nested_items.name: databaseName
nested_items.description: The name of an Amazon Timestream database.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the database table into which to write the measure records.

nested_items.name: dimensions
nested_items.description: Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each measure record.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the Amazon Timestream database table record.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value to write in this column of the database record.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the time column.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: An expression that returns a long epoch time value.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression described in value.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a confirmationUrl. If this is a new destination, a new TopicRuleDestination is created if possible.

nested_items.name: confirmationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.

nested_items.name: headers
nested_items.description: The HTTP headers to send with the message data.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The HTTP header key.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.

nested_items.name: signingRegion
nested_items.description: The signing region.

nested_items.name: serviceName
nested_items.description: The service name to use while signing with Sig V4.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing role.

nested_items.name: destinationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of Kafka action's VPC TopicRuleDestination.

nested_items.name: topic
nested_items.description: The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The Kafka message key.

nested_items.name: partition
nested_items.description: The Kafka message partition.

nested_items.name: clientProperties
nested_items.description: Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: headers
nested_items.description: The list of Kafka headers that you specify.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the Kafka header.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the Kafka header.

nested_items.name: openSearch
nested_items.description: Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: The OpenSearch index where you want to store your data.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of document you are storing.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that grants permission to write to the Amazon Location resource.

nested_items.name: trackerName
nested_items.description: The name of the tracker resource in Amazon Location in which the location is updated.

nested_items.name: deviceId
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the device providing the location data.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The time that the location data was sampled. The default value is the time the MQTT message was processed.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: An expression that returns a long epoch time value.

nested_items.name: unit
nested_items.description: The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression described in value.

nested_items.name: latitude
nested_items.description: A string that evaluates to a double value that represents the latitude of the device's location.

nested_items.name: longitude
nested_items.description: A string that evaluates to a double value that represents the longitude of the device's location.
